column4: consolekit (>= 0.7)?! there's no such version in any ubuntu release. show me your /etc/apt/sources.list please
hang on
http://pastebin.com/d386004e9
it looks sane, however i can't see a reason why a package could require consolekit 0.7... what does "apt-cache policy gnome-panel" tell you?
i don't understand... it's the right version for intrepid, and the right version of consolekit is 0.2... what consolekit version does "apt-cache depends gnome-panel" mention?
also, what's the currently installed version of consolekit? (first line of "apt-cache policy consolekit")
it doesn't actually mention a version number, just that it depends on it
actually, wait, gnome-panel *does* depend on consolekit?
it appears to
uh, check also with "apt-cache show gnome-panel | grep Depends
because after checking better - it *shouldn't* directly depend on it
oh man, what the heck happened to my apt-get?
i don't quite know. i suspect one package or another is the wrong version, though. have you ever had any third-party repositories enabled? (aside from the WINE one, i can see you have that)
nope, unless medibuntu counts
well, it does to an extent, but it tends to be safe enough...
so anyway does gnome-panel directly depend on consolekit according to "show"?
ok, but you say it depends on it according to "depends", so can you make out which packages it depends on it through? (just pastebin the whole "depends" output if you like)
eh, i'm lost completely. it depends on it directly, but it doesn't depend on it directly.
try giving a "sudo apt-get clean; sudo apt-cache gencaches; sudo apt-get update" and then try again installing
i'm out of ideas to be honest and i have to run for a bit, be back later
perhaps try simulating a removal of consolekit (just don't hit Y, or use the "--simulate" option of apt-get) and see what it'd also remove that depend on it
ftfy
